page.title: 01Kingdom of the White House
page.content: The south and mid west of the block is mainly sea with part of a striking 3 mile beach backed by sandunes up to the main road which have been grass implanted in a largely successful attempt to prevent them shifting. A small camping/caravan site is situated towards the northern end of the dunes. The central area of the block is coniferous forest surrounded by farmland, mainly rough grazing but with some cultivated grassland.The NW corner marks the start of an area of rocks and cliffs and is covered by heather and peat.Here is situated the 'White House of the Northern Gate', which stands alone and can be seen for miles around.The remaining area is residential with Dunnet village nestling in the dip between the farm- land hills.The only occupation in the area is farming sheep,diairy & silage.
